XUI wrapper for HTML radio input. Like a standard input[type="radio"]this component represents only a single option.

Usage:

<xui-radio ng-model="reference" value="string"|ng-value="expression" [title="string"]
        [is-disabled="expression"] [is-required="expression"]>[label text]</xui-radio>
Attributes:
ng-model Reference to a variable where the selected radio option value should be stored
value String value of this radio option
ng-value Object value of this radio option. Note: valueand ng-valueare mutually exclusive and only one must be used.
title Value to be shown as a tooltip
is-disabled Expression to determine if this radio should be disabled
is-required All radio buttons are required by default but if you want conditional validation then supply a boolean expression to this attribute.

Code samples

Carrot Onion Tomato
Model: {{ctrl.vegetable}}
Banana Apple Pear
Model: Name = {{ctrl.fruit.name}}, Color = {{ctrl.fruit.color}}
Note that equality is checked by comparing references, so setting {name: 'banana', color: 'yellow'}directly to model wouldn't update selected radio value. A reference to the same option value should be used in that case.
